short_summary: Consolidating national collection of 25 million historical and archaeological artifacts under construction in Gatineau, Quebec
description: The relocation service involves transporting and storing artifacts from 6 existing facilities to a new, purpose-built collection facility in Gatineau, Quebec, with an estimated volume of approximately 7,500 cubic meters and an estimated period of 1.5 to 2 years.
duration_in_months: It varies by type of item.
full_summary:
# Multi-City Moving/Relocation Services for the Parks Canada Agency

## Call for Information

The Parks Canada Agency (PCA) invites stakeholders to review the Request for Information (RFI) for multi-city moving/relocation services. This RFI is part of the agency's efforts to consolidate its collection of 25 million historical and archaeological artifacts across six existing facilities to a new, purpose-built facility in Gatineau, Quebec.

## Scope of Work and Timelines

The PCA needs to relocate and rehouse the artifacts from its current locations in Winnipeg, Ottawa, Quebec City, and Dartmouth to the new facility. The relocation process is expected to take 1.5 to 2 years, starting from Fall 2023. The artifacts will need to be carefully packed, loaded, transported, unloaded, unpacked, and stored in the facility's specialized storage system, comprising mobile shelving units, pallet racking, and secure storage.

## Service Requirements

The successful bidder will be required to:

* Provide multi-city moving and relocation services
* Handle various types of artifacts, including large, long, oversized, and small/fragile items
* Develop and implement a packing, shipping, and storage plan
* Coordinate logistics and transportation, including site visits to all facilities
* Ensure compliance with environmental and conservation regulations
* Develop and implement an Indigenous procurement strategy

## Tender Information

This RFI is not a formal solicitation, and the agency will not respond to questions in writing or circulate answers to all potential bidders. However, respondents with questions regarding this RFI may direct them to the Contracting Authority.

## Notes and Other Information

This RFI is an opportunity for bidders to review the project requirements and provide feedback. Please note that this RFI will not result in the award of any contract. The procurement of the services described in this RFI will not necessarily follow this request.

## Contact Information

Contact: Bonnie Knott, Contracting Advisor
Email: [bonnie.knott@pc.gc.ca](mailto:bonnie.knott@pc.gc.ca)

## Key Dates

* Expected posting of the request for proposal (RFP): March 2023
* Expected completion of the relocation process: December 2025
